Calculate the Inter Quartile Range (IQR) for 4, 10, 15,4,11,14,12,6,7:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

8

Explanation

• Arrange in ascending order: 4, 4, 6, 7, 10, 11, 12, 14, 15

• Calculate the median: 10

• Calculate the middle of the first 4 digits: 4,4,6,7 = (4 + 6)/ 2 = 5 = Q 1

• Calculate the middle of the last 4 digits: 11, 12, 14, 15 = (12 + 14)/ 2 = 13 = Q 3

• IQR = Q 3 – Q 1 = 13 – 5 = 8

Minimum to maximum values in any data is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Range

Range of a Data Set (Statistics): 

• In statistics, the range of a set of data is the difference between the highest and lowest values in that set. 

• To find the range, you subtract the smallest number from the largest number in the dataset. 

• For example, in the dataset {2, 5, 8, 10, 3}, the range is 10 - 2 = 8.

• Expresses the probability of a number of events occurring in a fixed period of time/ distance/ area/ volume

• i.e, if event occur with a known average rate & independently of the time since the last event

questions.text: Changing daily different colour coded bedsheets in hospitals under ESI is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Abhiyan Indradhanush 

"Abhiyan Indradhanush" within the context of ESIC (Employees' State Insurance Corporation) refers to a cleanliness initiative focused on daily bedsheet changes in ESIC hospitals, following a specific color pattern based on the VIBGYOR (Violet, Indigo, Blue, Green, Yellow, Orange, Red) sequence. This initiative is part of a broader health reforms agenda known as "ESIC 2.0" and is linked to the "Swachh Bharat Abhiyan" (Clean India Campaign).

questions.text: Keeping moisture content >20% and Spraying bagasse with 2% propionic acid (fungicide) is a management technique for:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Bagassosis

Bagassosis prevention focuses on minimizing exposure to sugarcane bagasse dust, especially in its moldy, dried form. Key strategies include dust control measures, personal protective equipment, medical surveillance, and maintaining proper bagasse storage to reduce dust generation. 

Detailed Prevention Strategies:

Dust Control:

• Wet Processing: Using a wet process during bagasse handling can significantly reduce dust. 

• Enclosed Apparatus: Enclosing bagasse handling equipment helps contain dust. 

• Exhaust Ventilation: Installing effective exhaust ventilation systems removes dust from work areas. 

• Moisture Content: Keeping the moisture content of bagasse above 20% and potentially spraying it with 2% propionic acid can help prevent dust formation.

questions.solution:

Village Health, Sanitation, and Nutrition Day (VHSND) is a monthly event held at the village level to provide health, nutrition, and sanitation services, particularly for women and children. It aims to bring healthcare to the community's doorstep and promote preventative and promotive health practices. VHSNDs are typically organized at Anganwadi Centre’s or other designated locations within the village.

questions.solution:

Obesity Assessment Tool: 

For assessment
–  Quetelet Index, BMI = Weight (kg)/ Height (m 2)
–  Ponderal Index, BMI = Height (cm)/cube root of body weight (pounds)

• Or, = Weight * 100/ Height3
–  Broca index, Ideal weight = Height (cm) – 100 
–  Corpulence index = Actual weight/ Ideal weight (Normal <= 1.2)
–  Lorentz formula, Ideal Weight =  Ht (cm) – 100 – Ht (cm) – 150
                                               2 (women) or 4 (men)

WHO measles elimination strategy includes all of the following except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mop up

Explanation

WHO Measles elimination strategy: Supplementation Immunization Service

Target: > 90%

• Catch up – 

– Nationwide vaccination campaign, targeting all children 9 months to 15 years (both India & WHO), irrespective of history of measles disease or vaccination status

• Keep up – 

– Routine vaccination aimed at vaccinating each birth cohort

• Follow up – 

– Subsequent nationwide vaccination campaign conducted every 2 – 4 years wherein all children born after catch up phase are given vaccine

questions.text: In a 6 membered family, 2 parents and 4 children all aged between 2- 6 years. 1 of child (3 years) is completely immunised, whereas other 3 siblings are unimmunized. On the 12th of August 2016, one of latter got measles. 2 other got measles 18th August. SAR is:

A child at his 15th birthday developed progressive mR followed by paralysis, muscle rigidity & death occurred at 17th birthday. In childhood child had developed fever with rash. Child also had night blindness. Disease child suffered in childhood is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Measles

Measles – Sub Acute Sclerosing pan Encephalitis (SSPE)

Subacute sclerosing panencephalitis (SSPE) is a rare, progressive, and ultimately fatal brain disorder caused by a persistent measles virus infection. It typically develops years after an initial measles infection, even if the initial illness was mild or unnoticed. Symptoms include cognitive decline, behavioural changes, involuntary muscle movements (myoclonus), seizures, and eventual neurological deterioration.

questions.text: Which of this is not a misnomer in epidemiologic nomenclature?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Survival Rate

Explanation:

Concept of Rate, Ratio, Proportion

• Proportion:

– Numerator is a part of denominator

– Multiplied by 100 (as always expressed in %): not always true as prevalence, is a proportion but multiplied by 1000

– Public Health importance: what fraction of the population is affected

• Rate:

– Proportion with time component included

– Multiplied by 1000 or more

– Public health importance: how fast the cases were identified

• Ratio

– Sex ratio (best example)

– Numerator is not a part of denominator

questions.text: A study was done to determine efficacy of fish oil in preventing progression of renal disease in patients of IgA nephropathy. Odd numbered are treated with fish oil & even numbered patients are treated with olive oil. Over the next 5 years it is seen that fish oil group (n = 50) 3 developed renal disease & olive oil group (n = 50) 17 developed. What is the study design?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Nonrandomised trial

Explanation: 

• Making Odd & even doesn’t ensure randomization as you can predict what the next patient will receive as intervention

• Many students would confuse it with systematic random sampling but in systematic random sampling; first participant is selected randomly

questions.text: While testing deleterious health hazards on a group of people after giving a drug & placebo, the following results were observed. What would be the NNT?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

80


ARR = I ne – I e = 1600/ 16000 – 1800/ 16000 = - 200 / 16000
(- sign because it is taking about ADR)
NNT = 1/ ARR = 16000/ 200 = 80

questions.text: Identify the plot in the image:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Funnel Plot

Meta-analysis and Systematic Review

• Enable researchers to incorporate multiple studies of the same question

– They provide better estimates of intervention effects in subgroups as n is higher

•    I2, forest plot (describes distribution of effect sizes)

Limitation:

 Effort: GIGO (Garbage in, Garbage out)

 Publication bias: Funnel plot, file drawer effect

 Only few variables from the studies can be used (reporting uniformity): apple & oranges effect

• Option C refers to PPV

questions.text: Which of the following should be screened at community level?
COVID 19 screening is a type:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All of the above

Explanation:

Types of Screening

questions.text: In case of diseases where we use cut-offs to determine disease presence or absence if the cut-off is raised to a higher value which of the following are true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All are true

Explanation:

Effect of Altering Cut-off's

questions.text: The phenomenon between B- C represents:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

• Lead time: advantage gained by screening i.e, early detection of disease ensures earlier initiation of treatment
• Screening time: of no use if applied after a final critical point

questions.text: The shaded area in red colour in the picture represents:
Match the following, which is false?
Image shown indicates which level of prevention?
Point ‘C’ indicates:

What would be the type of study design, if during the study period, data related to association between low birth weight and maternal smoking is studied by obtaining history of smoking by the women at the time of their antenatal visits, and then subsequently a correlation between birth weight and history of smoking is drawn?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Cohort study

Explanation

As follow is being done so it is a cohort study

choices.text: Incidence among exposed – Incidence among non-exposed
Incidence in total population – Incidence in non-exposed
If smoking is eliminated as risk factor there will be 95% reduction in annual incidence of lung cancer cases among the non-exposed
If smoking is eliminated as risk factor there will be 95% reduction in annual incidence of lung cancer cases among the population

questions.text: The attributable risk calculated for smoking and lung cancer is 95%. Identify the correct statement:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Incidence among exposed – Incidence among non-exposed
Explanation

questions.text: If mortality reduced by a drug but didn't cure the disease, then what will happen?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Prevalence increases

As the disease is not cured and duration increases so prevalence increases and incidence remains same. Example: when insulin was first discovered then people dying with diabetes started staying alive but were not cured so prevalence increased

questions.text: Meta analysis does not involve
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Randomization

Studies are not chosen randomly; rather they are chosen using objective criteria
Steps of Meta Analysis:

• Identification: preliminary studies which are relevant

• Selection: select those which are relevant 

• Abstraction: take out subtopics from articles only those which are important  

• Analysis/ Interpretation

questions.text: Best study to assess strength of association is given by:

Steps in case control study are: 

1. Matching 

2. Follow up 

3. Selection

4. Inference of result
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

1,3,4

Steps of Case Control Study:

a. Selection of cases and control

Matching

b. Measurement of Exposure using OR

c. Inference of result 

(Follow Up is a typical feature of cohort study)

questions.text: External validity which is true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Generalization

Type of validity:

<!--[if !supportLists]-->•      <!--[endif]-->Internal:  valid conclusions can be drawn for individuals in a sample

<!--[if !supportLists]-->•      <!--[endif]-->External: valid conclusions can be generalized to a larger population

choices.text: Death rate of a population adjusted to a standard age distribution
Death rate of a population adjusted to a standard sex distribution
To eliminate age structure of different countries
To remove bias due to different age group population in different regions

questions.text: Standardised age mortality ratio is an indicator for all except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Death rate of a population adjusted to a standard sex distribution

Explanation

Standardization

• Standardized Population: Population where numbers in each age & sex group are known

• Used commonly in occupational studies

• Standardization removes confounding effect of different age structures (Age standardized death rate is best to compare vital statistics of countries)

• Types of standardization

– Direct:

– Indirect: used when no. of deaths for each age- specific stratum are not available

choices.text: In a population, if test shows more positive value in sensitivity, then there is lesser chance of people having disease

questions.text: Correct statement among following is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

PPV depends on prevalence

Explanation

• Option A & B (FALSE): Sensitivity and Specificity of a test are intrinsic properties and remain constant and don’t depend on the prevalence 

• Option C (FALSE): If the test shows more positive value in sensitivity, then there is greater chance of people having disease 

• Option D (TRUE): More the prevalence more is the PPV and less is the NPV

questions.text: 1 year old infant came for routine investigation, took DPT 1st dose at 6 weeks? After that other dose were not administered. What should be the next step?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Give 2nd dose

In case of missed vaccinations there is no need to restart the vaccination again; we can just give the missed dose as per the schedule maintaining the requisite gap between subsequent doses

choices.text: It should not be given after 7 days
It has to be given in MAX amount at the deltoid
If human IG is not present, then give equine IG

questions.text: Rabies immunoglobulin not true is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

It must be given in MAX amount at the deltoid

Explanation 
Rabies Immunoglobulin
• Once in lifetime
• Ineffective after 7th day of first vaccine dose
• Administered into or around the wound sites
• HRIg: 20 IU/ kg; ERIg: 40 IU/ kg

questions.text: A 50-year-old male presents with fever for 3 weeks duration. Antibiotics and anti-malarial don’t work. Abdomen distention present, rK 39 dipsticks test is positive. What will be the next management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Amphotericin B

This is a case of Leishmaniasis with DOC being Liposomal Amphotericin B

choices.text: Use the vial if inner square lighter than the outer circle
Use the vial if inner square starts to change colour but still lighter than outer circle
Use the vial if inner square same colour as outer circle
Discard the vial if inner square darker than outer circle

questions.text: For VVM identify the incorrect statement:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Use the vial if inner square same colour as outer circle

•      Direct marker of:

–     Heat exposure

–     Efficiency of cold chain

•      Indirect marker of potency

•      Direct relationship exists between rate of color change & temperature

–     Lower the temperature, slower color change

•      Outer circle, inner square

–     Inner square is 10% of outer circle

–     Made of heat sensitive material)

–     In OPV, outer circle is blue & inner one is white

–     Validation of VVMs: optical densitometer

•      Example of nominal scale (usable or not usable)

•      VVM number refers to the time in days that it takes for the inner square to reach the colour indicating a discard point, if vial is exposed to a constant temperature of 37 C

•      Type of VVM:

–     Attached to Label: vaccine can be kept for 28 days

–     Attached to Other site (cap or neck): discarded at end of immunization session or within 6 hours of opening, whichever comes 1st

questions.text: Change in trends of disease over a period of time with regards to noncommunicable disease is called as:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Secular

Trends of Disease
• Secular/ Long term: gradual increase/ decrease in number of cases as compared to previous years
– Best demonstrated by line graph
– Disease showing: NCDs, TB, Typhoid
• Periodical: aseptic meningitis (yearly)
• Seasonal: Due to environmental factors
• Cyclical trend: 
– Influenza
– Type A epidemic – every 2 -3 years
– Type A pandemics – every 10 – 15 years
– Because time is required for build-up of susceptible population for disease to attack (due to variations in levels of herd immunity)

questions.text: A 2-year-old unvaccinated child presents with fever, cough, sneezing along with dusky red maculopapular rash, which had started behind the ears and had spread rapidly to the face, neck and body. His most probable diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Measles

Rash starting behind the ears is indicative of measles

questions.text: ‘World Breast Feeding Week' is celebrated in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

1st week of August

World breast feeding week is celebrated in 01st week of August

choices.text: Children within the age group of 1 to 19 years are covered in it.
Diethyl carbamazine is the drug that is administered in this programme.
It is an initiative undertaken by the Ministry of Education.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about the 'National Deworming Day?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Children within the age group of 1 to 19 years are covered in it.

National deworming day is celebrated twice in a year generally in February and after 6 months in August but date varies from year to year. The target age group is 6 months to 19 years children who are given albendazole. It is under the MOHFW.

choices.text: Less than one case per 1000 population.
Less than one case per 10,000 population.

questions.text: Leprosy eradication' means:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

<1 case/ 10000 population

Eradication is defined as leprosy cases less than 1 case per 10000 population

questions.text: Under the ambit of the 'National Vector Borne Disease Control Programme (NVBDCP), which of the following disease is not covered?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Cutaneous Leishmaniasis

Explanation 
NVBDCP covers 6 diseases – Malaria, Filaria, JE, Chikungunya, Dengue, Leishmania (visceral)

questions.text: Which of the following is not a discipline that is under the domain of Ministry of AYUSH?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Allopathy

Allopathy system is under the MOHFW
